author: Dan Lepard
serves: Makes enough to layer and cover one 20cm/8in round birthday cake
method: Mix the icing sugar, glucose, condensed milk, flavouring and butter with an electric mixer in a bowl until smooth and light, then beat in the baking margarine until smooth. In a jug, stir the icing sugar into the cream until dissolved, then add any colouring or flavouring you want, or just leave it plain. Beat this gradually into the butter mixture until light and fluffy.  This buttercream keeps very well covered at room temperature for 2-3 days and can be warmed slightly and re-beaten if the texture is too firm.
ingredients: 300g/10½oz icing sugar,  25g/1oz liquid glucose,  50g/1¾oz condensed milk,  2 tsp vanilla extract or other flavouring,  200g/7oz unsalted butter, softened,  100g/3½oz baking margarine, softened,  200g/7oz icing sugar,  100ml/3¾fl oz double cream,  colouring and flavouring
